intro: Guatteria aberemoa, commonly known as the Mexican bell pepper tree, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to Central America and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Lauraceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces small, edible berries that are often used in local cuisines. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in secondary forests. Its ornamental value and edible fruits make it both ecologically and economically significant in its native range.
